intro: Collinsia franciscana, commonly known as the Franciscan bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It has slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected under the Endangered Species Act.
